questions.question: Which of the following is commonly used to graphically represent the input-output relationship of a combinational logic circuit?
options: Waveform diagram
Flowchart
Truth table
State diagram
Timing diagram

questions.question: In an out-of-order execution processor, what is the primary purpose of 'register renaming'?
options: To reduce the number of physical registers required by the CPU.
To map architectural registers to a larger set of physical registers to eliminate Write-After-Read (WAR) and Write-After-Write (WAW) hazards.
To allow the compiler to use more general-purpose registers during code generation.
To ensure that all instructions access the same physical register file regardless of their functional unit.
To dynamically reorder instructions in the instruction cache to improve fetch bandwidth.

questions.question: In the context of System-on-Chip (SoC) design, what is the primary role of the Advanced eXtensible Interface (AXI) protocol (part of ARM's AMBA specification)?
options: To define the instruction set architecture for ARM processors.
To provide a high-performance, asynchronous communication standard between different IP blocks within an SoC.
To standardize the interface for connecting external memory (like DDR SDRAM) to the SoC.
To serve as a synchronous, transactional, and high-bandwidth interconnect for communication between master and slave IP blocks.
To manage power states and clock gating for various SoC components.

questions.question: In modern deep submicron IC manufacturing, what is the primary purpose of Optical Proximity Correction (OPC)?
options: To reduce the overall power consumption of the integrated circuit by optimizing transistor sizes.
To detect and fix logical errors in the circuit design before fabrication.
To compensate for distortions and diffraction effects during photolithography, ensuring that the features printed on the wafer accurately match the intended design shapes.
To improve the yield by selectively disabling defective parts of the manufactured chip.
To optimize the routing of interconnects to minimize signal delay.

questions.question: What is the primary function of a 'parity bit' in digital systems, often used in memory or communication?
options: To store extra data that can be retrieved in case of a power failure.
To perform complex arithmetic operations at high speed.
To detect single-bit errors in a block of data.
To indicate whether a memory block is currently being accessed by the CPU.
To accelerate the process of virtual-to-physical address translation.
